[[University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign]] ([[Doctor of Philosophy|PhD]]) | occupation = [[Chairman]] & [[CEO]] of [[IBM]] | employer = IBM | predecessor = [[Ginni Rometty]] }} '''Arvind Krishna''' (తెలుగు - అరవింద్ కృష్ణ) is an [[Indian Americans|Indian-American]] business executive serving as the [[Chairman]] and [[CEO]] of [[IBM]]. He has been the CEO of IBM since April 2020 and took on the role of Chairman in January 2021.{{cite web |url=https://newsroom.ibm.com/2020-12-16-Arvind-Krishna-Elected-IBM-Chairman |title=Arvind Krishna Elected IBM Chairman |last= |first= |date=December 16, 2020|website= |publisher= |access-date=October 22, 2021 |quote=}}{{cite news |title=IBM names Indian-origin Arvind Krishna as CEO |url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/technology/in-other-news/310120/ibm-names-indian-origin-arvind-krishna-as-ceo.html |work=[[Deccan Chronicle]] |agency=[[Asian News International]] |date=January 31, 2020 |access-date=October 8, 2020 |archive-date=October 5, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201005175348/https://www.deccanchronicle.com/technology/in-other-news/310120/ibm-names-indian-origin-arvind-krishna-as-ceo.html |url-status=live }} Krishna began his career at IBM in 1990, at IBM's [[Thomas J. Watson Research Center]],{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ibm-ceo-factbox/ibms-surprise-ceo-arvind-krishna-to-take-over-from-ginni-rometty-idUSKBN1ZU2LW |title=IBM's 'surprise' CEO: Arvind Krishna to take over from Ginni Rometty |work=[[Reuters]] |date=January 31, 2020 |access-date=October 9, 2020 |archive-date=April 15, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200415022512/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ibm-ceo-factbox/ibms-surprise-ceo-arvind-krishna-to-take-over-from-ginni-rometty-idUSKBN1ZU2LW |url-status=live }} and was promoted to [[senior vice president|Senior Vice President]] in 2015, managing [[IBM Cloud]] & Cognitive Software and [[IBM Research]] divisions. He was a principal architect of the acquisition of [[Red Hat]], the largest acquisition in the company’s history.{{cite web |url=https://www.linkedin.com/in/arvindkrishna/ |title=Arvind Krishna |website=[[LinkedIn]] |access-date=October 8, 2020 |archive-date=September 14, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150914013251/https://www.linkedin.com/in/arvindkrishna |url-status=live }}{{cite news|url=https://fortune.com/2020/02/03/ibm-ceo-arvind-krishna-what-you-need-to-know/|title=What you need to know about new IBM CEO Arvind Krishna|work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]|first=David Z.|last=Morris|date=February 3, 2020|access-date=October 8, 2020|archive-date=October 5, [[Telugu language|Telugu]]-speaking [[Hindu]] family in [[West Godavari District]] in the [[Coastal Andhra]] region of [[Andhra Pradesh]], [[India]].{{cite news |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/technology/news/story/meet-arvind-krishna-new-ibm-ceo-who-is-latest-south-indian-to-head-global-it-company-1642327-2020-02-01 |title=Meet Arvind Krishna, new IBM CEO who |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201009093112/https://www.indiatoday.in/technology/news/story/meet-arvind-krishna-new-ibm-ceo-who-is-latest-south-indian-to-head-global-it-company-1642327-2020-02-01 |url-status=live }}{{cite news |title=Arvind Krishna ascends beyond cloud at IBM |url=https://tech.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/corporate/arvind-krishna-ascends-beyond-cloud-at-ibm/73825286 Major General Vinod Krishna, was an army officer who served in the [[Indian Army]] and his mother, Aarathi Krishna, worked for the welfare of Army widows.{{cite news |url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/company/corporate-trends/industry-leaders-peers-raise-a-toast-to-good-news/articleshow/73824893.cms |title=Industry leaders, peers raise a toast to good |url-status=live }} == Education == He did his schooling at [[Stanes Anglo Indian Higher Secondary School]], [[Coonoor|Coonoor, Tamil Nadu]] and at [[St Joseph's Academy, Dehradun]]{{cite news |last1=Jan 31 |first1=TIMESOFINDIA COM / |title=Who is Arvind Krishna IBM? All you need to know about IBM's new CEO Arvind Krishna {{!}} India News - Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/all-you-need-to-know-about-ibms-new-ceo-arvind-krishna/articleshow/73793401.cms |work=The Times of India |language=en}} before receiving a BTech degree in [[electrical engineering]] from [[Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur]] in 1985. He subsequently moved to the United States to earn a [[PhD]] in [[electrical engineering]] from the [[University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign]] in 1991.{{Cite web|last=Krishna|first=Arvind|title=|url=https://www.linkedin.com/in/arvindkrishna/|url-status=live}}{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/technology/ginni-rometty-ibm-ceo.html |title=Ginni Rometty to Step Down as C.E.O. of IBM |last=Lohr |first=Steve |date=2020-01-30 |work=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=2020-01-31 |issn=0362-4331 |archive-date=January 31, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200131015908/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/technology/ginni-rometty-ibm-ceo.html |url-status=live }}{{cite news |url=https://www.outlookindia.com/newsscroll/arvind-krishna-ibmer-who-joins-elite-indianorigin-ceos-club/1722319 |title=Arvind Krishna: IBMer who joins elite Indian-origin CEOs' club |agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service]] |date=2020-01-31 |work=[[Outlook (Indian magazine)|Outlook]] |access-date=2020-01-31 |archive-date=January 31, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200131110417/https://www.outlookindia.com/newsscroll/arvind-krishna-ibmer-who-joins-elite-indianorigin-ceos-club/1722319 |url-status=live }}{{cite news |title=IITian Arvind Krishna appointed CEO of global tech giant IBM; 5 little known facts about him |url=https://www.businesstoday.in/current/corporate/iitian-arvind-krishna-appointed-ceo-of-global-tech-giant-ibm-5-little-known-facts-about-him-ginni-rometty/story/395024.html |work=[[Business Today (India)|Business Today]] |date=January 31, 2020 |access-date=October 8, 2020 |archive-date=October 5, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201005153013/https://www.businesstoday.in/current/corporate/iitian-arvind-krishna-appointed-ceo-of-global-tech-giant-ibm-5-little-known-facts-about-him-ginni-rometty/story/395024.html |url-status=live }} He is the recipient of distinguished alumni awards from both IIT Kanpur and the University of Illinois Urbana–Champaign. == Career == === Professional career === Krishna joined IBM in 1990, at IBM's [[Thomas J. Watson Research Center]], and continued in Watson Research for 18 years till 2009. Next he held General Manager role in Information management software and systems and technology group of IBM. In 2015, he was promoted to senior vice president of [[IBM Research]].{{cite web |url=https://www.itjungle.com/2015/01/12/tfh011215-story02/ |title=IBM Reorganizes To Reflect Its New Business Machine |first=Timothy Prickett |last=Morgan |website=IT Jungle |date=January 12, 2015 |access-date=October 9, 2020 |archive-date=January 1, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200101003105/https://www.itjungle.com/2015/01/12/tfh011215-story02/ |url-status=live }} He later became senior vice president of IBM's [[cloud computing|cloud]], and cognitive software division. He also led the building and expansion of new markets for IBM in [[artificial intelligence]], cloud, quantum computing, and [[blockchain technology]].{{cite news |url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/company/corporate-trends/ibm-raises-iitian-arvind-krishna-to-ceo-effective-april/articleshow/73789608.cms |title=IBM raises IITian Arvind Krishna to CEO |url-status=live }} He was a driving force behind IBM's $34 billion acquisition of [[Red Hat]], which closed in July 2019.{{cite news |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/06/arvind-krishna-takes-over-as-ibm-ceo.html |title=IBM's new CEO takes over today — here's his plan |first=Jon |last=Fortt |work=[[CNBC]] |date=April 6, 2020 |url-status=live }} He was appointed IBM's CEO in January 2020, effective April 6, 2020,{{cite news |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/ginni-rometty-stepping-down-as-ibm-ceo-11580420650 |title=IBM's as CEO since 2012.{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-30/ibm-names-arvind-krishna-as-ceo-rometty-to-retire-at-year-s-end |title=IBM Names Arvind Krishna CEO, Replacing [[Satya Nadella]], [[Shantanu Narayen]], and [[Sundar Pichai]] as an [[Indian American|Indian-American]] [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] of a major [[United States]] technology company.{{Cite news
